name: Lexer
body:
PROJECT - A2 LEXICON PARSER
----------------------------------------------------------------
          Team Name : DeMorgan's loss.
          Authors   : Can Dalgir, David Luong.
          Project   : 1
          Style     : Pragmatic
DESCRIPTION
----------------------------------------------------------------
  This program is designed to handle the A2 programming language
  lexicon. The program is additionally designed to handle dynamic
  lexer ruleset(s) to avoid further programming language 
  transformation(s).

TEST CASES
----------------------------------------------------------------
 *Currently there are 3 test cases we are running:
  _Test Case# 1_
  `prog main { print( "ASCII:", " A= ", 65, " Z= ", 90 ); }`
 
  _Test Case# 2_
  `prog main { // Find the circumference of a circle.`
   `pi = 3.14;`
   `print( "Input radius> " );`
   `rx = input ( float );`
   `circum = 2 * pi * rx;`
   `print( "Circumf= ", circum );`
  `}`
 
  _Test Case# 3_
  `prog main { // Find the hypotenuse of a right triangle.`
   `print( "Input legs> " );`
   `a = input( int );`
   `b = input( int );`
   `print( "Hypotenuse= ", ( a * a + b * b ) ^ 0.5 );`
  `}`

CLASS | RuleSet_A2
----------------------------------------------------------------
  The designed class is exclusively for reading the A2 lexers
  ruleset(s) for programming the A2 lexer/parser.
  
         |-ruleset        
         |---> A2_Lexer
         |---> A2iD_
         |---> A2Key_
         |---> A2Op_

CLASS | Parser_A2
----------------------------------------------------------------
  The designed class is exclusively for parsing the desired
  input from the user through a provided '.txt' file.
  
         |-parser_
         |---> File_Text

Support Information
----------------------------------------------------------------
If any questions or problems arises you can contact us at @Jayteare or @davidluong
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
